mvMOBSTER

mvMOBSTER is a package that provides a set of functions to analyse cancer multi-sample data with MOBSTER and other tools for cancer evolution. This package provides essentially a wrapper to several other packages that implement fitting strategies commonly used in cancer evolution studies.

Other packages

This packages wraps calls to:

  • MOBSTER, a package for tumour subclonal deconvolution which combines Dirichlet mixtures with distributions predicted by theoretical population genetics;

  • VIBER, a package for tumour subclonal deconvolution that implements variational fits for Binomial mixture models;

  • CNAqc, a package that provide a set of metrics to assess the quality of Copy Number Alteration (CNA) calls

Help and support

mvMOBSTER has its own webpage at GitHub pages.

Installation

You can install the released version of mvMOBSTER from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("caravagn/mvMOBSTER")
